issue.title: Docs: testnet onion seeds are outdated
issue.body:
`contrib/seeds/nodes_test.txt` seems to be completely outdated.

I get not one outgoing onion connection using the following `bitcoin.conf` in which the testnet onion nodes are added with `addnode=` option (assuming Tor listening on `127.0.0.1:9050`):
```
testnet=1
onion=127.0.0.1:9050
listen=1
discover=1
onlynet=onion
# contrib/seeds/nodes_test.txt
addnode=thfsmmn2jbitcoin.onion
addnode=it2pj4f7657g3rhi.onion
addnode=nkf5e6b7pl4jfd4a.onion
addnode=4zhkir2ofl7orfom.onion
addnode=t6xj6wilh4ytvcs7.onion
addnode=i6y6ivorwakd7nw3.onion
addnode=ubqj4rsu3nqtxmtp.onion
```

rename.to: Docs: testnet onion seeds are outdated

events.body:
With the following command one gets the testnet onion seed node list from Bitnodes:
`dig +short txt testnet-seed.bitnodes.io | tr --delete '"'`
I tried with these in bitcoin.conf, instead the ones in contrib/seeds/nodes_test.txt.
```
addnode=ocasutxnvl4lwegq.onion
addnode=cu6octp6yo754wda.onion
addnode=lkiggf5esgs7d5z6.onion
addnode=rhcv7q2quqn74zlr.onion
addnode=nq7cak6pufzs2ou2.onion
addnode=nec4kn4ghql7p7an.onion
addnode=qlllezfaif5cscnx.onion
addnode=zmtr2di735ngxpcl.onion
addnode=4syvownyxejvqbzn.onion
```
But in the first ten minutes no connection. Then unexpected (in the mean time I did something other) one connection to `nkf5e6b7pl4jfd4a.onion`, which had not been added in bitcoin.conf but is listed in contrib/seeds/nodes_test.txt. At least that one is up.
The above is mainnet. Is there much point in trying to update testnet given the above? (my testnet seed does crawl onion nodes)

Of the 7 onion URLs hard-coded in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/contrib/seeds/nodes_test.txt, only one address is responsive at this time: `nkf5e6b7pl4jfd4a.onion:18333`

To reproduce:

1. `bitcoind -testnet -debug=1 -proxy=127.0.0.1:9050 -onlynet=onion`

2. For each in `nodes_test.txt`:
`bitcoin-cli -testnet addnode <....onion> add`

3. `cat .../debug.log | grep "SOCKS5 connected"`

I also recompiled with the testnet DNS seeds in `chainparams.cpp` removed to force bitcoind to use the hard-coded seeds list before manually double checking with `addnode`

Is there a reason why the only hard-coded testnet seeds are these 7 onion URLs?

The feature request didn't seem to attract much attention in the past. Also, the issue seems not important enough right now to keep it sitting around idle in the list of open issues.

Closing due to lack of interest. Pull requests with improvements are always welcome.
Those Tor v2 testnet seeds were all updated in May 2021 to Tor v3 ones in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22060 (I may have a look at how many of them are up currently).
